poem_title: PROLOGUE to COMUS, Perform'd for the Benefit of the General Hospital at BATH, 1756.
author: John Hoadly
poem_alt_title: Perform'd for the Benefit of the General Hospital at BATH , 1756.

lines.line_text: WELL, I've been beating up for volunteers,
But find that — charity has got no ears.
I first attack'd a colonel of the guards —
Sir, charity — consider its rewards.
With healing hand the saddest sores it skins,
And covers — oh! — a multitude of sins.
He swore, the world was welcome to his thoughts:
'Twas damn'd  to hide one's faults;
And with that sin his conscience ne'er was  —
The only  he never had committed.

stanzas.stanza_text:
WELL, I've been beating up for volunteers,
But find that — charity has got no ears.
I first attack'd a colonel of the guards —
Sir, charity — consider its rewards.
With healing hand the saddest sores it skins,
And covers — oh! — a multitude of sins.
He swore, the world was welcome to his thoughts:
'Twas damn'd  to hide one's faults;
And with that sin his conscience ne'er was  —
The only  he never had committed.

lines.line_text: Next, to my knight I plead. He — shook his head;
Complain'd the stocks were low — and trade was dead.
In these Bath-charities a tax he'd found
More heavy than — four shillings in the pound.
What with the play-house, hospital, and abbey,
A man was  — unless he'd look quite shabby.
Then such a train, and such expence to fit!
My lady, all the brats, and cousin Kit —
He'd steal, himself — perhaps — into the pit.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Next, to my knight I plead. He — shook his head;
Complain'd the stocks were low — and trade was dead.
In these Bath-charities a tax he'd found
More heavy than — four shillings in the pound.
What with the play-house, hospital, and abbey,
A man was  — unless he'd look quite shabby.
Then such a train, and such expence to fit!
My lady, all the brats, and cousin Kit —
He'd steal, himself — perhaps — into the pit.

Vows that all works of  she regards;
Raffles for Chinese Gods, card-houses, shells,
Nor grudges to the music, or the bells,
But has a strange  to nasty

Old lady Slipslop, at her morning cards,

lines.line_text: I hope your lordship — then my lord replies —
No doubt, the governors are — very wise;
But, for the play, he — wonder'd at their choice.
In Milton's days such stuff might be the taste,
But faith! he thought it was damn'd dull and chaste.
Then swears, he to the charity is hearty,
But can't, in honour, break his evening party.

stanzas.stanza_text:
I hope your lordship — then my lord replies —
No doubt, the governors are — very wise;
But, for the play, he — wonder'd at their choice.
In Milton's days such stuff might be the taste,
But faith! he thought it was damn'd dull and chaste.
Then swears, he to the charity is hearty,
But can't, in honour, break his evening party.

lines.line_text: When to the gouty alderman I sued,
The nasty fellow, ('gad!) was downright rude.
Is begging grown the fashion, with a pox!
The mayor should set such housewives in the stocks.
Give you a guinea! z—ds! replied the beast,
'Twou'd buy a ticket for a turtle-feast.
Think what a guinea-a-head might set before ye —
Sir — mullet — turbot — and a grand John Dorey,
I'll never give a groat, as I'm a sinner,
Unless they gather 't in a dish, at dinner.

stanzas.stanza_text:
When to the gouty alderman I sued,
The nasty fellow, ('gad!) was downright rude.
Is begging grown the fashion, with a pox!
The mayor should set such housewives in the stocks.
Give you a guinea! z—ds! replied the beast,
'Twou'd buy a ticket for a turtle-feast.
Think what a guinea-a-head might set before ye —
Sir — mullet — turbot — and a grand John Dorey,
I'll never give a groat, as I'm a sinner,
Unless they gather 't in a dish, at dinner.

lines.line_text: I trust, by art and more polite address,
You fairer advocates met more success;
And not a man compassion's cause withstood,
When  pleaded for such
